intro: Manettia seleriana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a tropical shrub native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are dark green on top and silvery white underneath. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. Manettia seleriana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
